content: this is a summary of a civil case that took place in the vilnius city district court the case involved a matrimonial property dispute between two parties referred to as the applicant and the defendant the court concluded that the property which included a car and a motorcycle should be divided in a way that is fair to both parties the applicant applied for the dissolution of their marriage citing issues such as differences in views and constant tension both parties agreed to the application and requested to retain their respective surnames the court also noted that the parties had joint credit obligations the court decided to approve the request to dissolve the marriage and assigned ownership of the motorcycle to the applicant and the personal property right to the vehicle to the defendant the defendant was ordered to pay court fees and the costs for serving procedural documents were also assigned to the defendant

metadata.marital_regime: issues relatively division of common properties
